it.emarolab.owloop.aMORDescriptor

Interface MORGrounding<J extends org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLObject>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Semantic, Semantic.Ground<it.emarolab.amor.owlInterface.OWLReferences,J>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MORConcept, MORConcept.Classify<D>, MORConcept.Define, MORConcept.Disjoint<D>, MORConcept.Equivalent<D>, MORConcept.Sub<D>, MORConcept.Super<D>, MORDataProperty, MORDataProperty.Disjoint<D>, MORDataProperty.Domain, MORDataProperty.Equivalent<D>, MORDataProperty.Range, MORDataProperty.Sub<D>, MORDataProperty.Super<D>, MORIndividual, MORIndividual.DataLink<D>, MORIndividual.Disjoint<D>, MORIndividual.Equivalent<D>, MORIndividual.ObjectLink<D>, MORIndividual.Type<D>, MORObjectProperty, MORObjectProperty.Disjoint<D>, MORObjectProperty.Domain, MORObjectProperty.Equivalent<D>, MORObjectProperty.Inverse<D>, MORObjectProperty.Range, MORObjectProperty.Sub<D>, MORObjectProperty.Super<D>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MORBase, MORClassifyConcept, MORConceptBase, MORDataPropertyBase, MORDefinitionConcept, MORDefinitionDataProperty, MORDefinitionIndividual, MORDefinitionObjectProperty, MORDomainDataProperty, MORDomainObjectProperty, MORFullConcept, MORFullDataProperty, MORFullIndividual, MORFullObjectProperty, MORGrounding.ConceptInstance, MORGrounding.DataInstance, MORGrounding.GroundBase, MORGrounding.IndividualInstance, MORGrounding.ObjectInstance, MORHierarchicalConcept, MORHierarchicalDataProperty, MORHierarchicalObjectProperty, MORIndividualBase, MORLinkIndividual, MORObjectPropertyBase, MORTypeIndividual

    public interface MORGrounding<J extends org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLObject>
extends Semantic.Ground<it.emarolab.amor.owlInterface.OWLReferences,J>
    The main interface for Semantic.Ground implemented in the aMOR API.

    This interface contains all the Grounds used by the aMOR Descriptor (i.e.: MORConcept, MORIndividual, MORDataProperty and MORObjectProperty). As well as, It implements common facility to interface with an OWL ontology though a OWLReferences, which are implemented also by the above Descriptors; just for simple usage.
    By using this class each Descriptor is actually link to a specific OWL entity to be described as well external users can access to any further feature of the standard OWL API.
    Each MORGrounding.GroundBase represents an reference to an OWL ontology (i.e.: Semantic.Ground.getGroundOntology()), which is shared between more MORGrounding.GroundBases, without reinstating nether the ontology nor the reasoner. As well as link each Semantic.Descriptor to a particular instance in such ontology (i.e.: Semantic.Ground.getGroundInstance()) to be synchronised with respect to a particular feature with respect to the ontological OWL representation (e.g.: disjoint, equivalent, sup/super etc.). More in particular, the class defined in this interface are:

    • MORGrounding.GroundBase: which is a base implementation for all the classes below.
    • MORGrounding.IndividualInstance: used to ground descriptions about MORIndividual.
    • MORGrounding.ConceptInstance: used to ground descriptions about MORConcept.
    • MORGrounding.DataInstance: used to ground descriptions about MORDataProperty.
    • MORGrounding.ObjectInstance: used to ground descriptions about MORObjectProperty.
    File: it.emarolab.owloop.aMORDescriptor.MORGrounding
    Licence: GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE. Version 3, 29 June 2007
    Author: Buoncompagni Luca (luca.buoncompagni@edu.unige.it)
    affiliation: EMAROLab, DIBRIS, University of Genoa.
    date: 21/05/17

        default org.semanticweb.owlapi.reasoner.OWLReasoner getReasoner()

        Returns:
        the reasoner of the Semantic.Ground.getGroundInstance().

      • getOWLOntology

        default org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology getOWLOntology()

        Returns:
        the base ontology (i.e.: OWL API) interface of Semantic.Ground.getGroundInstance().

        Returns:
        the base data factory (i.e.: OWL API) interface of Semantic.Ground.getGroundInstance().

        default void saveOntology(java.lang.String filePath)
        Save the ontology in a specified file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to the file to create (or overwrite).

      • saveOntology

        default void saveOntology(java.lang.String filePath,
                          boolean saveReasoned)
        Save the ontology in a specified file by making all the inferred axioms of the OWLReasoner as facts (i.e.: asserted).
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to the file to create (or overwrite).
        saveReasoned - true to make inferred axiom as asserted, false to store only the assertions.

      • setReasonedQuery

        default void setReasonedQuery(boolean reason)
        It enable/disable the use of the reasoner during aMOR querying (i.e.: {@link OWLReferences}.get...(..))
        Parameters:
        reason - true to enable reasoning during aMOR query. False to query only for asserted axioms in the OWL ontology.

      • isReasonedQuery

        default boolean isReasonedQuery()
        It returns if the aMOR querying (i.e.: {@link OWLReferences}.get...(..)) returns also reasoned axioms or only asserted facts.
        Returns:
        false if the aMOR querying returns only asserted facts. True if also reasoning inferring is considered.

      • setCompleteQuery

        default void setCompleteQuery(boolean complete)
        It enable/disable exhaustive description of the reasoner during aMOR querying.
        Parameters:
        complete - true if the query returns all the results (except for OWLThing). False if only the representative element should be given.

      • isCompleteQuery

        default boolean isCompleteQuery()
        It returns if aMOR querying give an exhaustive descriptions.
        Returns:
        true if the query returns all the results (except for OWLThing). False if only the representative element is given.
